name: Introduction to Religious Studies
description: This course provides an introduction to the study of religion from a wide variety of perspectives, including those of history, anthropology, psychology, and philosophy.

name: History of World Religions
description: This course provides an overview of the history of major world religions and their impact on culture and society.

name: Religious Ethics
description: This course explores the ethical implications of various religious beliefs and practices.

name: Comparative Religion
description: This course provides a comparative analysis of the beliefs, rituals, and practices of various religious traditions.
